article.title: Starbursts in and out of the star-formation main sequence

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dashed line in Figure 5 represent?
choices: The upper limit of SFR for galaxies with an Herschel detection.
The median SFR-M* relation at z=2.
The limit above which galaxies are classified as starbursts.
The redshift evolution of the SFR-M* relation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What conclusion can be drawn from Figure 10 about the size of star-forming regions in z~2 massive galaxies as measured by ALMA compared to their rest-frame V-band size?
choices: ALMA sizes are systematically larger than the rest-frame V-band sizes.
ALMA sizes are comparable to the rest-frame V-band sizes.
ALMA sizes are systematically smaller than the rest-frame V-band sizes.
There is no clear relation between the ALMA and rest-frame V-band sizes.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the bold squares in the top panel of Figure 12 represent?
choices: Local galaxies with mid-IR sizes measured from AKARI.
Local galaxies with mid-IR spectral signatures of AGNs.
z~2 ALMA galaxies with power-law AGNs.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the solid purple line in the top panel of Figure 13 represent?
choices: The relation between gas fraction and starburstiness obtained by Magdis et al. (2012a)
The relation between gas fraction and starburstiness obtained by Tacconi et al. (2018)
The median gas fraction for z=2.3 and M*=1.4x10^11 Mâ˜‰
The scatter in gas fraction for MS galaxies.
